(area, power_pad).explanation: Larger chip area typically requires more I/O pads for connectivity, directly increasing pad-related power consumption;

(area, power_switching).explanation: Larger chip area generally contains more transistors and logic gates, leading to increased switching activity and higher dynamic power consumption;

(area, time).explanation: Chip area and execution time are independent design metrics, as timing is determined by critical path delays rather than total area;
